732194f-a.title: Islands - Welfare Island - [Hospital for The Treatment of Tuberculosis.]
732194f-a.text:
New York City's New Hospital for the Treatment of Tuberculosis.
Nov. 14, 1913         P.A. Walter, photographer

Neg. #2487

732187f-a.title: Islands - Welfare Island.
732187f-a.text:
(1)
Welfare Island, its western shore on the East River, as seen from Carl Schurz Park, looking southward. In the right background is
visible the Queensborough Bridge.
Summer 1924.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date.
June 24, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The eastern shore of the island, as seen from the State Barge Canal Terminal, Long Island City, looking southward.
November 6, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

732188f-a.title: Islands - Welfare Island.
732188f-a.text:
Welfare Island (center of view), looking westward from the Queens end of the Queensborough Bridge. In the foreground appears part of the shore of Long Island City, Queens, and across the island; Manhattan.
July 17, 1925.
P. L. Sperr.

732189f-a.title: Islands - Welfare Island.
732189f-a.text:
View of northern tip of Welfare Island, looking north east from No. 25 East End Ave., Manhattan, into Astoria L.I. Hell Gate Bridge may also be
seen in the background.
About 1930.
Wurts Brothers.

732195f-b.title: Islands - Welfare Island - City Hospital.
732195f-b.text:
Welfare Island: The north end of the island, showing some of the hospital buildings. View 1 is from about East 65th Street,
Manhattan, and shows the island chapels.
View 3 shows the pier and a new hospital under construction,
Shown, too, is the Queensboro Bridge.

View 1: George L. Balgue  August, 1930
Credit line imperative
Views 2,3: P. L. Sperr  View 2: August 3, 1938
NO REPRODUCTIONS  View 3: July 11, 1937

732193f-a.title: Islands - Welfare Island - [Metropolitan Hospital - City prison.]
732193f-a.text:
Lower end of Welfare Island; formerly Blackwell's Island: showing the City prison and workhouse, and also the City Hospital.

About 1933.

Ewing Galloway.

732196f-b.title: Islands - Welfare Island - City Hospital.
732196f-b.text:
(1)
City Hospital. Welfare Island, as seen from East 53rd Street, Manhattan.
May 4, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same view, from 52nd Street.
May 4, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A more general view, from another angle, of the lower half of Welfare Island also, showing the City Hospital on the southern end.
May 4, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

732198f-a.title: Islands - Welfare Island - City Hospital Nurses Home.
732198f-a.text:
(1)
Along the south side of City Hospital Nurses Home, Welfare Island;
looking west across the Hudson River to Manhattan.
May 4, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing part of the architectural detail.
May 4, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

732201f-b.title: Islands - Welfare Island - Penitentiary - City Hospital.
732201f-b.text:
(1)
Penitentiary and City Hospital, on the south end of Welfare Island; as seen from the Queensboro Bridge; looking south west into Manhattan.
March 5, 1933.
P. L. Sperr

(2)
The same view from a slightly different angle.
May 4, 1933.
P. L. Sperr

(3)
Penitentiary and the City Hospital, on the southern half of Welfare Island, looking south east to Brooklyn.
May 4, 1933.
P. L. Sperr

732200f-b.text:

Metropolitan Hospital Nurses Home, Welfare Island.
April 5, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from another direction.
April S, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
Yet another Metropolitan Hospital Building, in the northerly part
of welfare Island.
April S, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

732191f-a.title: Islands - Welfare Island - [Long Island City shore.]
732191f-a.text:
Welfare Island: A northeastward view of the southern tip of the Island with the Queensborough Bridge and the Long Island City shore
(right) for a background.
Fall 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

732192f-a.title: Islands - Welfare Island.
732192f-a.text:
(1)
Southerly portion of Welfare Island, looking across the old prison
site, to Brooklyn.
June 16, 1936.
P. L. SPerr.
(2)
The same view, in close-up.
June 16, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
